lines.text: Guy, I love you. You smell of gasoline.
It's just another perfume.
Oh, Guy, I love you. A customer - I must run. I'll see you in front of the theater at eight.
I saw the cutest little rompers at the department store.
Admit that you're pleased.
I'd be more pleased if this baby had a father, and you had a husband.
Guy will come back.
Guy or someone else.
Absence is a funny thing. I feel like Guy left years ago. I look at this photo, and I forget what he really looks like. When I think of him, it's this photo that I see.
You seem very nervous.
I'm going out.
Alone?
None of your business.
It is.
With a girl.
Do you love her?
It could be.
Tell me the truth.
I love her.
You know, I think she suspects something.
Who?
Mother. When I said I was going to the theater with Cecile, she gave me a funny look.
What kind of look?
Like this. She knows Cecile hates shows, and I am a bad liar.
That's what you say.
I assure you I am.
We'll have children.
I'll name our daughter Francoise.
And if it is a boy?
It will be a girl. We've always had girls in the family.
One o'clock.
If Mother's not asleep, what a scene there will be.
My little girl, you're crazy! Thinking of marriage at sixteen!
Seventeen.
In love!
Am I too ugly or too stupid?

No, you're not ugly. You're not the fairest of them all, but you're neither ugly nor stupid. You have plenty of time. You think you're in love, but love is something different. You do not just fall in love with a face in the street.
He's a young man whom I've met several times, and he loves me. We want to get married.
I am shocked!
I went to the theater with him last night.
So you lied to me! And you admit it without shame!
I got drafted this morning, and I'll be away for two years. We'll talk about marriage later. With the war in Algeria, it will be a long time before I can come back.
But I would never be able to live without you!
Where were you?
With Guy.
What were you doing?
Mother, he's leaving. He'll be away for two years. I can't live without him. I'll die.
Stop crying. Look at me. People only die of love in movies.
Mr. Cassard came this evening. He was sorry he missed you. I'm sure he could give you some advice.
I can do without his advice.
You're wrong. For me, he is the kind of man...
Don't bother me with his kind.
You look terrible.
Leave me alone, Mother.
There's no reason for sulking. You're tired, but you're not dying.
It's not my weariness that saddens me. It's his silence. Guy left just two months ago. He only wrote me once.
Don't start that again.
If I knew where he was, I could write to him. I'm sure they've sent him someplace dangerous where he's risking his life.
I'm pregnant, Mother.
Pregnant by Guy? This is horrible! How is it possible?
Well, just like with everybody.
Don't joke. This is serious. What are we going to do?
What do you mean?
What are we going to do with the child?
Raise it.
What are we going to say?
To who?
Our friends, our neighbors!
We have no friends, and you never speak to the neighbors.
And Roland Cassart is coming to dinner tonight!
You don't need to tell him.
Roland Cassart asked for your hand in marriage.
I heard. You didn't tell him I'm pregnant.
I did not dare tell him.
Roland Cassart will not want to marry me when he sees I've been knocked-up.
Watch your language!

Since neither you nor I had the courage to tell him the truth, now at least it will show. Do you believe he'll take me like this? If he refuses me as I am, it shows that he never had deep feelings for me.
We'll raise this child together. He'll be ours. Please accept, Genevieve. I don't want to upset you. I love you, Genevieve.
Why didn't you tell me?
I didn't want to say anything. I thought you knew. You didn't suspect.
Of course, over the last few months. Her letters were not the same. She didn't answer my questions. She was writing without conviction. But marrying another man! I thought she was mad at me.
You have no family. Don't you want to stay here?
What will I do?
You'll help me. I'll be lonely.
You don't need anyone.
I need you, Madeleine.
Why don't you just say you don't like being alone? I don't see what I could do. I have no influence over you.
That's not true.
I don't like what you've become. You hang around with nothing to do. You're sad and bitter.
Poor Elise. There will be nothing left of her.
It's the opposite. She will be part of everything we do.
Are you happy?
Very happy, and it's all thanks to you, Madeleine.
Are you in mourning?
Mother died last autumn.
What did you name her?
Francoise. She's a lot like you. Do you want to see her?
I think you can go.
I'm going to see Guy.
I forbid you to see that boy. Stay here.
I don't want to respect you, but I'm going.
You stay right here! Anyway, Mr. Cassard will be here soon, and I want you to be present.
I've just seen Miss Genevieve. I would have liked...
She's gone out. The life we lead here is so sad for a young girl. This dreary shop. She's bored, and I fear she'll become depressed. Would you like some tea?
With pleasure.
We've just had a terrible fight about you.
About me?
She wanted to go out, but I didn't want her to. We had a row. We've been so lonely since my husband died.
